pullRequest.body:
Add some auxiliary lemmas of alternating words and left inverse sequences of Coxeter groups that will be useful to prove the Strong Exchange Theorem (among other uses). They are mainly taken from pages 12-13 of [Combinatorics of Coxeter groups by Anders Bjorner , Francesco Brenti](https://link.springer.com/book/10.1007/3-540-27596-7).

---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

For details on the "pull request lifecycle" in mathlib, please see:
https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/index.html

In particular, note that most reviewers will only notice your PR
if it passes the continuous integration checks.
Please ask for help on https://leanprover.zulipchat.com if needed.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

If you are moving or deleting declarations, please include these lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Moves:
- Vector.* -> Mathlib.Vector.*
- ...

Deletions:
- Nat.bit1_add_bit1
- ...

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

-->

nodes.body:
### PR summary [1bba3fb3c7](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19663/commits/1bba3fb3c7db1a0ec35c3fd77434068737b87232)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ getElem_alternatingWord`
`+ getElem_alternatingWord_swapIndices`
`+ getElem_leftInvSeq`
`+ getElem_leftInvSeq_alternatingWord`
`+ getElem_rightInvSeq`
`+ getElem_succ_leftInvSeq_alternatingWord`
`+ listTake_alternatingWord`
`+ listTake_succ_alternatingWord`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

I've left a few stylistic comments, they also apply elsewhere.

I also have a more structural comment: for reasons of maintainability and robustness, we (roughly speaking) only want a bare `simp` at the end of a proof. In the middle of a proof, it should be a `simp only`.
See https://leanprover-community.github.io/glossary.html#non-terminal-simp for more details.

If you replace `simp` with `simp?`, it will suggest a robust `simp only` replacement.

This process is called "squeezing simp". So could you please "squeeze" the non-terminal simps in this PR?

I've left a few stylistic comments, they also apply elsewhere.

I also have a more structural comment: for reasons of maintainability and robustness, we (roughly speaking) only want a bare `simp` at the end of a proof. In the middle of a proof, it should be a `simp only`.
See https://leanprover-community.github.io/glossary.html#non-terminal-simp for more details.

If you replace `simp` with `simp?`, it will suggest a robust `simp only` replacement.

This process is called "squeezing simp". So could you please "squeeze" the non-terminal simps in this PR?

We don't usually have empty lines in proofs. If you think the reader deserves a break, please write a comment
```
-- comment
/-
multi-line comment
-/
```
to explain the next part of the proof.

(This remark also applies below.)

I expect that you can inline the induction proof from the private lemma above.
But I didn't try it.
If that works, I would prefer inlining, since the current proof is a 1-liner.
I managed to prove it directly üëç

```suggestion
        rw [‚Üê even_add_two (n+k), ‚Üê Nat.add_assoc 2 n k] at h_even
```

```suggestion
  rw [getElem_alternatingWord i j p (k+1) (by omega), getElem_alternatingWord j i p k (by omega)]
```

pullRequest.title: feat(GroupTheory/Coxeter): add auxiliary lemmas for alternating words and left inverse sequences
